item.title: Black bags left by bins and other rubbish, 25th June
item.description:
As usual people have been dumping black rubbish bags and other rubbish near the bins with no thought for those of us who live next to them; some of the bags contain garden rubbish which is not being collected, neither has the brown bin been emptied.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cassland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chris Byrne of 17 Stirling close Sidcup Da146rp, 25th June
item.description:
Chris Byrne of 17 Stirling close Sidcup Da146rp repeatedly fly tips at my flat and on the grass verges around the property!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Crescent, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree dropping helicopter rooters and leaves and blocks light to my garden meaning nothing will grow, the sap is also ruining my shed roof, 25th June
item.description:
I have reported this problem twice before and been told it has been checked, the Google earth photo attached clearly shows it blocks the light to my garden. An autumn/winter photo would also clearly show the mess it causes in my garden with leaves and helicopter rooters. Please can something be done to ensure this tree is sufficiently pruned so I I am afforded light in my garden and do not have to constantly pick up mess during the autumn/winter. There is also a problem with children climbing this tree and shouting over my back fence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Park Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several young trees in South View need watering, 25th June
item.description:
I dont recall the council ever watering the young trees in South View. They are now in danger of dying as previous young trees in the road have. Surely its cheaper to water them than to keep replacing them when they die. One young tree I walked past this morning had literally fallen over as the ground is so dry. I pushed it back up tried it to the stake again and watered it. It took ages as I had to wait for the ground to get wet enough so the water didnt run off into the road. I can water one or two trees but not the whole road. The council needs to do their bit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South View, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedges blocking pavement, 25th June
item.description:
Hedges around 30 The Pantiles are so overgrown that they are blocking most of the pavement so that you have to walk in the road to go past. Partially sighted people will find the overhang dangerous. Each year they grow further and further across the pavement and nothing seems to be done except a slight trim which only makes them grow more.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Pantiles, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weekly fly tipping on Craigerne Road, 25th June
item.description:
Fly tipping just happened today. Tonight the foxes will break the plastic bag. And over the coming days, the rubbish will spread in the street so that we live in a sea of garbage. Since the council aren’t doing anything, my plan is to set up my own cctv, monitor the street and take care of the situation myself.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Charlton Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parked vehicle has been vandalised, 25th June
item.description:
A few days ago noticed this red Fiat 500 parked in The Avenue, just before the railway bridge, with rear and side windows smashed. Drivers door mirror has since been removed/stolen. Car looks in otherwise good condition, but likely to be a target for vandals

item.title: Dumped Rubbish and insecure building site, 25th June
item.description:
Once again I am reporting a new pile of rubbish dumped in Melvin Road SE20 8EU by the side fence of the empty property 78Croydon Road. And shouldn’t the empty property/building site be more secure as the signs on the broken gates say DANGER KEEP OUT ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melvin Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
